This project is designed to equip school leaders with the clearest picture possible of internet connectivity for Georgia‚Äôs students and teachers for the upcoming school year.

Georgians are encouraged to download the free Ookla Speedtest app (Android or iOS-Apple) to the various devices that they use to connect to the internet (smartphones, tablets, laptops, and desktop computers) and take several tests in the places where connectivity is important to them. The easy-to-use Speedtest, along with the information available at the Broadband Initiative website, will assist school leaders as they plan for their digital learning strategies.

Houston County School District will host its annual Teacher Recruitment Fair on Feb. 29, 2020, at Veterans High School. Teachers interested in employment with the system are invited to attend the job fair from 9:00 a.m. until noon.

Teacher candidates are encouraged to arrive before the fair starts at 9:00 a.m. to allow time to check-in and attend a brief information session in the auditorium. Doors open at 8:00 a.m.

For more information on teaching in our district, visit http://bit.ly/2tEIiew.

A new elementary school will open in Bonaire for the 2020-2021 school year. Bonaire Primary School will serve students in grades Pre-K through 2. The Board of Education has drafted a zoning proposal for the new school and three elementary schools: Bonaire Elementary, Hilltop Elementary and Matt Arthur Elementary. A parent meeting will be held on Jan. 30, at 6:00 p.m. at Veterans High School in the auditorium to provide information and invite parent input.

The proposed zoning map is posted at the three schools and to the Houston County Board of Education website, https://www.hcbe.net/bonaireprimaryzoning.
